issue.title: Not changing summaries if the array place is blank
issue.body: Wrap the code that updates the summary HTML in an if statement, so that it only updates if there is something to update, and leaves it if the summery Array place is blank

issue.title: Dynamic title
issue.body: What if the initial title started out kind of like it is, but then later was just changed to something like "Country of origin for the global refugee population in the year 1999" Or something like that. I feel like we could both reduce clutter and improve readability

issue.title: Complete README
issue.body:
Before we submit this project, there are some questions we are supposed to answer, and I think we put them in the read me. Its stuff like what tech did we use, what is next for the project, things like that.

Submission is at 6PM Pacific (8PM Central)

issue.title: fade out past and future summaries

labels.name: wontfix
labels.description: This will not be worked on

issue.body:
Feature request: What if you are in 1992, and the summary for that year is talking about say, the collapse of the USSR. And 3 years before that is is the previous summary, maybe saying something about the first american /Iraq war. And the next one after 1992 is maybe in 95, talking about Darfur. (Im making those up, idk history). What if the current year summary (collapse of the USSR) was presented normally. use while-loop to find the previous and next summaries (Iraq, Darfur, in the example). While loop because some in between years are blank. Then, we present all three summaries in order. broken up with space (
in html) The past and previous summaries we have faded though, so they are 50% or more transparent.

issue.title: "rewinding misconceptions"
issue.body:
Feature: to make the project more informative / useful
Biggest misconception I would like to change is: majority of refugees are dudes coming here to steal our welfare. Why dont they contribute to society?
Truth: like 50% of them are under the age of 11. like 80% or more are children, or women with children. No wonder it takes like 10-15 years before they pay more in taxes than they cost, these people should be in school!

I want to find a way to include stuff like this, charts and graphs, maybe a bar at the bottom that updates every 30 seconds or something like a news ticker... lets talk about it.
